intro: Astragalus zangelanus, commonly known as Zangilan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
